answer: A machine that can be programmed to carry out sequences of arithmetic or logical operations automatically.
A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.
Relating to, using, or expressed in a system of numerical notation that has 2 rather than 10 as a base.
A basic unit of information in computing and digital communications.
A group of binary digits or bits (usually eight) operated on as a unit.

text: Write a function that takes in a number and returns the square of that number.
